section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these Rules, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Continuing Professional Development Scheme (專業進修計劃) means the scheme referred to in section 4 of the Continuing Professional Development Rules (Cap. 159 sub. leg. W);
CPD accreditation points (評審學分) has the meaning assigned to that term by section 2 of the Continuing Professional Development Rules (Cap. 159 sub. leg. W).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Conditions subject to which a practising certificate may be issued
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 6(5)(b) of the Ordinance, the conditions subject to which the Society may issue a practising certificate to a solicitor are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a solicitor applying for the issue of a practising certificate for the first time, any one or more of the conditions numbered 2, 6 and 7 in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a solicitor who has been censured or ordered to pay a penalty or costs by the Solicitors Disciplinary Tribunal constituted under section 9B of the Ordinance since he was last issued a practising certificate, any one or more of the conditions specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a solicitor who has been invited by the Society to give an explanation in respect of any matter relating to his conduct since he was last issued a practising certificate and has failed or refused to give an explanation in respect of that matter which the Council regards as sufficient and satisfactory, and has been notified in writing by the Society that he has so failed or refused, any one or more of the conditions specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a solicitor who has been suspended from practice since he was last issued a practising certificate and the period of his suspension has expired, any one or more of the conditions specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in the case of a solicitor who has had his name removed from or struck off the roll of solicitors since he was last issued a practising certificate, his name has been restored to the roll of solicitors, any one or more of the conditions specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in the case of a solicitor who has become bankrupt since he was last issued a practising certificate, and has been discharged within the meaning of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6), any one or more of the conditions specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: in the case where a judgment in Hong Kong or elsewhere which involves the payment of money has been given against the solicitor since he was last issued a practising certificate, not being a judgment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: limited to the payment of costs; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as to the whole effect of which upon him he is entitled to indemnity or relief from some other person; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: for a sum less than HK$50,000 or which has been satisfied,

paragraph.continued: any one or more of the conditions specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: in the case of a solicitor who has not been in full-time practice of law for 2 continuous years immediately prior to the giving of notice of intention to apply for a practising certificate to the Society, any one or more of the conditions specified in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case of a solicitor who was a principal in or a consultant of a firm at the time of an intervention of the firm by the Society under section 26A and Schedule 2 to the Ordinance during the preceding 18 months, any one or more of the conditions specified in Schedule 1.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Matters to be considered by the Society when imposing conditions on a practising certificate

subsection.leadIn: In considering for the purposes of section 3 the imposition of any of the conditions set out in Schedule 1, the Society may have regard to the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the condition numbered 2 in Schedule 1—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the extent of the solicitor’s experience in the practice of law in Hong Kong or elsewhere;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whether or not the solicitor is to be supervised by a solicitor who holds an unconditional practising certificate or has substantial experience in the practice of law in Hong Kong or elsewhere;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the employer is not a solicitor, the nature of the employer’s business and the work proposed to be undertaken by the solicitor, the size of the employer’s business and its legal department;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the condition numbered 3 in Schedule 1—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the identity and disciplinary record of the partners;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the nature and frequency of complaints made against the partnership;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the number of successful claims made against any of the partners for negligence or breach of duty;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in case of the condition numbered 4 in Schedule 1—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature and frequency of complaints made against the solicitor;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conditions which have been placed on the solicitor’s practising certificate since his date of admission;

subsection.leadIn: In considering for the purposes of section 3 the imposition of conditions in relation to the issue of a practising certificate to a solicitor, the Society may have regard to the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case mentioned in section 3(b), the findings and orders of the Solicitors Disciplinary Tribunal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case mentioned in section 3(c), the seriousness of the matter and the nature and extent of the explanation, if any, given by the solicitor;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case mentioned in section 3(d) or (e)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the findings and orders of the Solicitors Disciplinary Tribunal or the reasons for the solicitor’s suspension from practice or removal of his name from the roll of solicitors;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the period of time that has elapsed since his suspension or the removal of his name from the roll of solicitors;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the solicitor’s activities during that intervening period;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case mentioned in section 3(g), the amount of the judgment and the solicitor’s current financial circumstances.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Applicant to give 6 weeks prior notice of application
section.content: In any case where section 3 would have effect if an application had been made, the applicant shall not less than 6 weeks before he applies for a practising certificate give to the Society notice in writing in Form 1 in Schedule 2 of his intention to so apply, unless the Society or the Chief Judge otherwise orders.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Effect of issue of practising certificate free of conditions
section.content: Where section 3 has effect by reason of any such circumstances as are mentioned in section 3(b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h) or (i) and a practising certificate free of conditions is issued by the Society under the Ordinance to a solicitor, section 3 shall not after the issue of the practising certificate have effect in relation to that solicitor by reason of those circumstances except as regards any circumstances of whose existence the Society is unaware at the time the certificate is issued.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Conditions subject to which a practising certificate may be amended

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 6(5)(e) of the Ordinance, and subject to subsection (2), the conditions that may be added by the Society to an already issued practising certificate are any one or more of the conditions specified in Schedule 1.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) has effect in relation to a practising certificate already issued to a solicitor in the case, and only in the case, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the event of an application for a practising certificate being made by the solicitor at any time during the period for which his current certificate is in force, this section would have effect in relation to him by reason of any of the circumstances mentioned in section 3(b), (c), (d), (g) or (i);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the solicitor has entered into a voluntary arrangement within the meaning of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) with his creditors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the solicitor has been charged with, or convicted of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an offence involving dishonesty or deception; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an offence which in the opinion of the Council has compromised or impaired or is likely to compromise or impair the reputation of the profession.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Matters to be considered by the Society when imposing conditions on an already issued practising certificate
section.content: In considering for the purposes of section 7(1) the addition of any of the conditions set out in Schedule 1 to an already issued practising certificate, the Society may have regard to the matters set out in section 4.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the amendment shall have effect from the date when the solicitor concerned is notified of the Society’s intention to amend the practising certificate.

If the Society’s decision to amend a practising certificate by adding conditions is appealed against under section 6(9) of the Ordinance, the decision shall be suspended in its operation as from the day on which the appeal is made until such appeal is disposed of under section 6(11) of the Ordinance.

Where there is pending against any judgment or order an appeal by a solicitor which, if successful, would result in section 7 no longer being applicable to him, the Society shall not give a notification under subsection (1) in his case so long as the appeal is pending, unless in the opinion of the Society the proceedings on that appeal have been unduly protracted by him or are unlikely to be successful.
Subsection (3) does not apply to the exercise of the Society’s powers under this section by virtue of section 7(2)(c).

section.name: s10
section.heading: Removal of conditions
section.content: Any condition imposed by the Society in accordance with these Rules shall remain in effect until such time as the Society determines otherwise.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Conditions Subject to which a Practising Certificate may be Issued

section.name: s1
section.content: The solicitor shall complete a period of practice (not exceeding 24 months) as specified by the Council under the supervision of a solicitor holding an unconditional practising certificate.

section.name: s2
section.content: The solicitor may only practise in an employment that has been approved by the Council.

section.name: s3
section.content: The solicitor may only practise in a partnership that has been approved by the Council.

section.name: s4
section.content: The solicitor may only practise on his own account with the approval of the Council.

section.name: s5
section.content: The solicitor shall not sign cheques on a client account.

section.name: s6
section.content: The solicitor shall accumulate such CPD accreditation points or undertake and complete one or more courses of the Continuing Professional Development Scheme as specified by the Council.

section.name: s7
section.content: The solicitor shall undertake additional academic or training courses or examinations specified by the Council.
